Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior surface is caked with a dark-brown resinous deposit and an off-white, discoloured to green, deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393241) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393241)
